result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher L Green
Current: C/O Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 3048 N 47Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with codefendant listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

2:53 PM Defendant Christopher L Green in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Christopher L Green. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
